history.text: Hello. Have you seen The Avengers, the marvel comics movie?
I have not seen it. What is it about?
It's about a team of superheroes called The Avengers, and the film has the same title.
That sounds interesting. Who is in the movie?
It has a great cast, including Rober Downey Junior and Scarlet Johansson.
I like those actors. What character does Scarlet Johanson play?
She plays one of the superheroes.
Who directed the movie?
The film was directed by Joss Whedon.
I have heard of him. Did he write the screenplay too?
Yes, he did.

That's cool. 
Did Joss Whedon produce this movie too, or does it have different producers?
It was produced by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures.
Disney does some good movies. What about the music in this movie. Does it have good music?
I don't know much about the movie score.
OK. What other movies has Joss Whedon made?
I couldn't really say about that either.
I think the hulk character, played by Mark Ruffalo, is very entertaining in the movie.

Is there anything really inter
esting about this movie that might make me want to see it?
I do like the hulk too.
Critics say it is witty and sophistocated.
It's not as formulaic as you might expect from a superhero movie.
That's good. I like superhero movies that are not typical.
The plot centers around the God Loki and his plan to take over the Earth. He has a powerful artifact called the tesseract.
Wow, that's interesting. There's a God in this movie?
Yes. Thor is another god that appears in the movie as well.
Ok I see. Is Thor Loki's father?
I don't believe so.
Loki is Thor's brother.
Oh ok, that sounds familiar. And what is the tesseract? What does it do?
It's a mysterious artifact that the villains are using to open a wormhole into another dimension that bring forth an army to subjugate the Earth.
Wow, this movie sounds awesome. I'm definitely going to see it now.
Yes, I would look for it on blu-ray, as it was released in 2012.
Ok I will. Thanks for the information!
You're welcome.

uid1response.feedback: I didn't have a document to reference, but the other user was active and very informative. The last half of the conversation really made me want to see it, because the user did a good job of explaining the most exciting parts of the plot.
